msContents.summary: Side 1 (with the fibers): Proclamation made in the reign of Severus Alexander. Side 2 (against the fibers): List of emperors and length of reign.

msItemStruct.note: Side 1: 13 lines of text written with the fibers.

Side 2: 20 lines of text written against the fibers. Text is in two columns: emperor names and their lengths of rule. Parts of at least two other lines at the lower right, probably in a different hand.
Museum of Archaeology and Anthropology collection

supportDesc.support: 13.8 x 13.4cm. 2 tears on the top (2 cm and 3 cm). There is an overlay strip about 2cm wide extending almost the entire depth of the piece, with the fibers running vertically over an otherwise horizontal base, apparently during manufacture (since the writing is over the top of it). It does not seem to have affected the reverse side (the king list). The top and right margins seem to be intact on one side, and all the margins around the king list are visible.

origin.origDate: 223 CE (with the fibers), 249-251 CE (against the fibers)

provenance.p: Excavated by Grenfell and Hunt (1896-7) on behalf of the Egyptian Exploration Fund, and donated to the University Museum in return for its support (1901, Dr. Parrish Collection).

taxonomy.desc: APIS keywords are controlled locally at the institution level. They are not necessarily consistent.

div.ab: Side 2 (against the fibers): [1] Reigns of the Emperors; [2] Augustus 43 (years); [3] Tiberius 22 (years); [4] Claudius 4 (years); [5] Nero 14 (years); [6] Vespasian 10 (years); [7] Titus 3 (years); [8] Domitian 15 (years); [9] Nerva 1 (year); [10] Trajan 19 (years); [11] Hadrian 23 (years); [12] Antoninus Pius 23 (years); [13] Antoninus Comodus 32 (years); [14] Severus 25 (years); [15] Antoninus 4 (years); [16] Alexander 13 (years) Pauni 4; [17] Maximinus 3 (years) (as long as a virgin rules); [18] Gordian 6 (years); [19] Philip 6 (years); [20] Decius 1 (year). [D. Harris-McCoy]
